Title.evidence: Title: SAPTAP Trial: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: This multicentre, non-inferiority randomised controlled trial (RCT)

Participants.evidence: Conducted in seven medical centres in the Netherlands, the trial included adults with symptomatic chronic venous disease.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to SAP or TAP

Objective.evidence: evaluated whether single ambulatory phlebectomy with or without delayed endovenous truncal ablation (SAP) is non-inferior to thermal endovenous ablation with concomitant phlebectomy (TAP)

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the VEINES-QOL/Sym score at 12 months.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Participants were randomised to SAP or TAP using an automated service, with allocation concealment.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was not feasible for patients or clinicians due to procedural differences.

Number_Randomised.evidence: From January 2015 to December 2018, 464 patients were randomised (SAP 227, TAP 237)

Result_Outcome.evidence: VEINES-QOL scores were 52.7 (95% CI 51.9 to 53.9) for SAP and 53.8 (53.3 to 55.1) for TAP.

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were minor and similar between groups, with 25 events in SAP and 22 in TAP.

Funding.evidence: Funding: Supported by Erasmus Medical Centre Rotterdam.
